Class PSState

java.lang.Object

All Implemented Interfaces:
IPSCatalogIdentifier, IPSCatalogItem, IPSCatalogSummary, Serializable
public class PSState
extends Object
implements Serializable, IPSCatalogSummary, IPSCatalogItem

Represents a workflow state

findTransitionByName

public PSTransition findTransitionByName(String tname)
Scans all transitions that are part of this state, looking for one that has a name that matches the supplied value. The name of a transition is obtained by calling PSTransitionBase.getTrigger().

Parameters:
tname - If blank, null is returned. Value is case- insensitive.
Returns:
If blank, or a matching transition is not found, null is returned.

transitionList - The list, may be null or empty.

fromXML

public void fromXML(String xmlsource)
             throws IOException,
                    SAXException
Description copied from interface: IPSCatalogItem
Restore the given item from an XML description. The implementation of this is up to the class in question. It is acceptable to use the JavaBean APIs to accomplish this.

Specified by:
fromXML in interface IPSCatalogItem
Parameters:
xmlsource - the string that represents this item, never null or empty
Throws:
IOException - if there is a problem reading the xml source
SAXException - if there is a problem parsing the xml source

toXML

public String toXML()
             throws IOException,
                    SAXException
Description copied from interface: IPSCatalogItem
Serialize the information in the item into XML format. The implementation of this is up to the class in question. It is acceptable to use the JavaBean APIs to accomplish this.

Specified by:
toXML in interface IPSCatalogItem
Returns:
a string containing the XML that represents the item. This information must contain the items guid, but is not required to hold the type information.
Throws:
IOException - if there is a problem serializing the object
SAXException - if there is an issue converting the object to XML

isAdhocEnabled

public boolean isAdhocEnabled()
Determines if any of the state roles have adhoc assignment enabled

Returns:
true if adhoc assignment is enabled, false otherwise.
